intro: Astronia rugata, commonly known as the rough-leaved astronia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Astronia rugata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
